title.rendered: “IDF Chief of Staff’s Mission in Jabalia: Rescuing Captives and Dismantling Hamas’ Military Arm”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The Chief of Staff in the heart of Jabalia: “We want to bring our captives alive back home, and to bring back those captives who are unfortunately no longer alive to be buried in Israel.”

The Chief of Staff, Lieutenant General Herzl Halevi, visited today (Tuesday) in the heart of Jabalia, in the Gaza Strip, and met with the commanders who participated in the operation to rescue the bodies of the captives to Israel. The Chief of Staff held a situational assessment and tour with the Commander of the Southern Command, Major General Yaron Finkelstein, Commander of Division 98, Brigadier General Dan Goldfus, and the Brigade commanders.

Attached is a video from the Chief of Staff’s speech:
https://bit.ly/3wJJYnn

Attached is a video on the subject:
https://bit.ly/4axh1Jh

Attached are photos on the subject:
https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC210520247538738726

The full words of the Chief of Staff are attached: “We are in a war we said from the start would be long-lasting. They have been digging here for years for defense, and this isn’t taken down in a week nor in a month. Our mission, as the commander said, is to kill as many commanders, as many terrorists as possible, to destroy the infrastructure. The pressure we want to apply, will also help us to squeeze and bring living captives alive. We are ready to undertake dangerous and complicated operations to bring back the bodies of our captives to be buried in Israel. This holds great value and I ask you to speak with the fighters about these things. We are dismantling the military arm of Hamas, we want to bring our captives alive back home, and we want to bring back those captives who are unfortunately no longer alive to be buried in Israel. These are very important tasks. This message that even though there was a place here we didn’t reach last time, and now we are reaching it, there’s no place, no matter how many explosives he has put in a wall and how many traps he has set – there’s no place that can withstand the attack of the IDF’s artillery.”
